intro: Lecokia cretica, commonly known as the Cretan lecokia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a feathery appearance. Lecokia cretica is often found growing in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in sunny to partially shaded environments.
